subject: Economics
title: Why Nations Fail: Extractive vs. Inclusive Institutions
description: A quick, practical guide to Why Nations Fail: Extractive vs. Inclusive Institutions.

hook.text: Nogales, Arizona and Nogales, Sonora share a fence. Same geography, same culture, same history. One is prosperous.

buildup.text: Acemoglu and Robinson argued the key divider is institutions: inclusive ones spread power and opportunity.

discovery.text: Inclusive institutions: secure property rights, fair courts, competitive markets, democratic governance.

twist.text: Extractive institutions can produce growth â€” China grew spectacularly under authoritarian rule.

climax.text: Institutions are the deep determinant of development.

punchline.text: Good borders don't make good neighbors. Good institutions do.

quiz.question: What do Acemoglu and Robinson mean by 'inclusive institutions'?
options: Institutions that include all ethnic groups
Systems that spread power and opportunity: secure property rights, fair courts, competitive markets, and democratic governance
Institutions that are free to join
